installPrerequisites.headline: Install required tools
installPrerequisites.content:
Before we have a look at this course and the example exercise, we need to download and install a few software tools.
  • Please download and install the newest Java JDK (at least Java JDK 14). Make sure to choose JDK and not JRE.
  • Please download and install Eclipse IDE for Java Developers (2020-03 or later)
  • Please download and install SourceTree with git (4.0.1 or later for macOS and 3.3.8 or later for Windows).
installPrerequisites.hint: Make sure that the git command line tools are also installed during the installation of SourceTree. In case you are using Linux, you can e.g. use Git Kraken or the command line.

sourceTreeSetup.headline: Setup SourceTree
sourceTreeSetup.content: Watch the following video and follow the steps to setup SourceTree. Afterwards we are done with the setup and can have a look at the course page and its content.
sourceTreeSetup.hint: Copy and insert <tt>https://bitbucket.ase.in.tum.de</tt> as your base URL

exercises.headline: Exercises
exercises.content: This tab lists all exercises of the selected course.

exerciseRow.headline: Current week
exerciseRow.content: The exercises of the current week will be displayed on top of the exercise list.

currentExercise.headline: Current Exercise
currentExercise.content: In this tutorial we will have a look at the <tt>Hello World</tt> exercise.

exerciseType.headline: Exercise type
exerciseType.content: The exercise type can be distinguished by the exercise icon. Here it is a programming exercise.

exerciseTags.headline: Exercise tags
exerciseTags.content: The listed tags will give further information on the exercise classification, e.g. by difficulty.

courseInformation.headline: Course information
courseInformation.content: This box displays general course information, such as the amount of exercises and the start and end time of the course.

upcomingDeadlines.headline: Upcoming deadlines
upcomingDeadlines.content: See what exercises have to be completed in the next few days.

lectures.headline: Lectures
lectures.content: You can find and download all lecture slides from this tab.

statistics.headline: Statistics
statistics.content: This tab shows your current exercise accomplishments statistics.

startExercise.headline: Start with your first programming exercise
startExercise.content: Click on the <tt>Start exercise</tt> button to start working on the exercise. This action takes a few seconds, since a personal repository is setup for you in the background

cloneRepository.headline: Clone repository in SourceTree
cloneRepository.content: Watch the following video to understand how to clone a git repository in SourceTree. After this step you should click on the <tt>X</tt> button on the top right to cancel the tutorial for now and apply the steps that you have seen in the video. Afterwards just continue the tutorial from your account menu

inspectSourceTree.headline: Inspect SourceTree
inspectSourceTree.content: Watch the following video to understand the basic functions in SourceTree.

importEclipse.headline: Import the Java project in Eclipse
importEclipse.content: Watch the following video to understand how to import the project in Eclipse.

inspectProject.headline: Inspect Project
inspectProject.content: In this video step we will inspect the project and solve the given task.

commitAndPush.headline: Submit your changes
commitAndPush.content: Watch the following video to understand how to commit and push your changes.

reviewResult.headline: Review your result
reviewResult.content: After you have committed and pushed your changes as described in the previous video, the result will be automatically refreshed and displayed here. Artemis uses test cases to automatically assess your solution. If you now click on the exercise panel, you will get to the exercise detail page to review the test case results.
